Class BetterBag

  • java.lang.Object
    • BetterBag

  • public class BetterBag
extends java.lang.Object
    Improved bag of integers. A bag is an unordered collection of elements. Duplicates are allowed.
    Version:
    feb 02 107
    Author:
    Xavier Quinn and Chris Fernandes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BetterBag()
      Initialize an empty bag with an initial capacity of 10.
      BetterBag(int initialCapacity)
      Initialize an empty bag with a specified initial capacity.

      See if the bag contains a particular element

    • Constructor Detail

      • BetterBag

        public BetterBag()
        Initialize an empty bag with an initial capacity of 10.

      • BetterBag

        public BetterBag(int initialCapacity)
        Initialize an empty bag with a specified initial capacity.
        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - the initial capacity of this bag

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(int element)
        Add a new element to this bag. If the new element would take this bag beyond its current capacity, then the capacity is increased before adding the new element.
        Parameters:
        element - the new element that is being inserted

      • addAll

        public void addAll(BetterBag addend)
        Add the contents of another bag to this bag
        Parameters:
        addend - a bag whose contents will be added to this bag

      • clone

        public BetterBag clone()
        Generate a copy of this bag.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        returns a copy of this bag. Subsequent changes to the copy will not affect the original, nor vice versa.

      • countOccurrences

        public int countOccurrences(int target)
        Counts the number of occurrences of a particular element in this bag.
        Parameters:
        target - the element that needs to be counted
        Returns:
        the number of times that target occurs in this bag

      • ensureCapacity

        public void ensureCapacity(int minimumCapacity)
        Change the capacity of this bag to at least minimumCapacity. If the capacity was already at or greater than minimumCapacity, then the capacity is left unchanged.
        Parameters:
        minimumCapacity - the new capacity for this bag

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Getter for this bag's capacity
        Returns:
        the number of elements this bag has the ability to hold

      • remove

        public boolean remove(int target)
        Remove one copy of a specified element from this bag.
        Parameters:
        target - the element to remove from the bag
        Returns:
        true if removal was successful; false if target doesn't exist (which means the bag will be left unchanged)

      • size

        public int size()
        Determine the number of elements in this bag
        Returns:
        the number of elements currently in this bag

      • trimToSize

        public void trimToSize()
        Reduce the current capacity of this bag to its actual size (i.e., the number of elements it contains).

      • getRandom

        public int getRandom()
        Accesses a random element in this bag
        Returns:
        a random element from this bag. The bag is left unchanged (i.e. the element is not removed). If the bag is empty, the smallest possible integer is returned (i.e. the static constant Integer.MIN_VALUE is returned)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return status of this bag as a String. For example, if a bag of capacity 10 contained the elements 1, 2, and 3, the returned string would be "{1, 2, 3} (capacity = 10)". The order in which the elements are listed is not guaranteed.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        bag's contents and capacity as a String

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Tells if bag is empty or not
        Returns:
        true if bag contains no elements; false otherwise

      • removeRandom

        public int removeRandom()
        remove a random element from this bag and return it
        Returns:
        the random element that has been removed from this bag. If the bag is empty, it is left unchanged and the smallest possible integer is returned (i.e. the static constant Integer.MIN_VALUE is returned)

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int target)
        See if the bag contains a particular element
        Parameters:
        target - the element to be searched for
        Returns:
        true if bag contains the target element; false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(BetterBag otherBag)
        Tests to see if this bag and another bag are equal. Two bags are equal if they contain the exact same elements, regardless of order or capacity. For example, the bags {1,4,9} and {9,4,1} are equal, even if they had different capacities. The number of duplicate elements must also be the same, so {1,4,4,9} and {1,4,9,9} are not equal.
        Parameters:
        otherBag - bag to be tested for equality with this bag
        Returns:
        true if bags are equal; false otherwise
